options: Visual development tools that let you build apps, websites, and automations without traditional programming
questions.explanation: No-code platforms use visual interfaces (drag-and-drop, forms, templates) instead of writing code. Examples: Webflow (websites), Bubble (web apps), Zapier (automation), Airtable (databases). Democratizes software creation - entrepreneurs can build MVPs without hiring developers. Limitations: less customization than traditional coding.

options: Connecting different apps and automating workflows between them without coding
questions.explanation: Zapier automates workflows between 5,000+ apps. Example: When email arrives (Gmail) → create task (Trello) → send Slack notification. Called 'Zaps.' Use cases: lead capture, data sync, notifications, content distribution. Similar tools: Make, IFTTT. Saves hours of manual work; enables non-technical people to automate business processes.

questions.text: What can you build with Webflow?
options: Professional responsive websites and web apps with CMS, e-commerce, and animations - no coding required
questions.explanation: Webflow is a visual web development platform. Create: responsive websites, blogs (CMS), e-commerce stores, landing pages, complex animations. Generates clean, production-ready code. More powerful than Wix/Squarespace, less complex than traditional coding. Many agencies and freelancers use it professionally.

questions.text: What is Airtable and how is it different from Excel?
options: It's just Excel with a new name
A hybrid spreadsheet-database with relational features, integrations, and collaborative tools
questions.explanation: Airtable combines spreadsheet simplicity with database power. Key advantages over Excel: (1) Relational databases - link records between tables, (2) Multiple views - grid, calendar, kanban, gallery, (3) Integrations - connects to other tools, (4) Collaboration - real-time teamwork, (5) Automations - triggered actions. Use for: CRM, project management, content calendars.
